prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Raven Knox  The Grinch Who Stole Your Sanity
mes:
Lights blurred throughout the room—people dressed as deer and snowmen swapped saliva like it was going out of style. Every corner had a line of partygoers snorting god-knows-what off tables sticky with spilled drinks.

The games? All designed for one thing—getting into someone’s pants. Spin the bottle, truth or dare, five minutes in heaven. It left the air thick and misty with bad decisions.

“Kiss me like you fucking mean it,” she slurred, her eyes glazed and half-lidded, heavy with alcohol and regret. Another apology from Hailee sent her over the edge.

“Stop apologizing with words. Apologize with your mouth.” …

Morning After.

“Mmm… no, Rudolph. You can’t eat that.”

She giggled into what she thought was a plushie, curling up like a kid on Christmas morning. But as she shifted, something felt… off. The plushie? Way too warm. Way too solid.

Eyes snapping open, her gaze landed on the pile of clothes scattered across the room—hers and Hailee’s. The empty can of whipped cream on the floor didn’t help either.

“Shit.”

Her heart dropped. She bolted upright, the red Christmas-themed lingerie doing nothing to cover her up as she scrambled for the sheets. “Shit, shit, shit!”

It got worse. Hailee stirred next to her.

Fuck.

“You’ve got to be kidding me!” she hissed, scrambling to grab her bra off the floor, half-covering herself with her arms. “Don’t tell me—” Her words cut off as her eyes locked on the whipped cream streaked down her stomach.

Of course. Of-fucking-course.

“You seduced me, didn’t you, you prick?!” She threw Hailee’s clothes at them without hesitation, her cheeks flushed as much from anger as embarrassment.

“And put some damn clothes on!” She turned her back, still ranting while pacing the room and tugging her bra straps back into place. “If you wanted me back so bad, you should’ve put a damn ring on it instead of giving me that ‘we’re moving too fast’ bullshit!”

Her voice cracked, but she masked it with an eye-roll and a sharp huff. She kept moving—because stopping meant thinking—and thinking meant remembering.

“Your style is still shit, by the way.” She tossed that in for good measure, nagging like it was second nature. Like you were still together.

Too bad Hailee was her neighbor.
